div.div: Mean seasonal pattern of distribution between the three periods.
div.p: White boxplot, light-grey boxplot and dark-grey boxplot correspond respectively to the 1985–1988; 1989–2002 and 2003–2010 periods. The thick line of e boxplot represents the median of 50,000 iterations, the box corresponds to the first and third quartile and the whiskers correspond to the 0.025 and 0.975 percentile.
Click here for additional data file.
Nby: number of years; nbm: number of month; nbp: number of inter-shift period; esp: Mean; lambda: Dirichlet concentration parameter; alpha: flat prior. The code was performed with Jags software.
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Evolution of the five phenological indicators between the tree periods (fish and zooplankton species).
div.p: Intervals around the mean (black points) represent the intervals of credibility at 95%. For the “Time of residence”, numbers correspond to the number of months of residence of species in the estuary. Letter a, b or c illustrates the significant differences between periods. The symbols refer to the decision tree ( Fig 3)
Click here for additional data file.

div.div: Evolution of the percentage of covering between predators and preys.
div.p: Intervals around the mean (black points) represent the intervals of credibility at 95%. Letter a, b or c illustrates the significant differences between periods. The symbols refer to the decision tree ( Fig 3)
Click here for additional data file.
